intro: Apargia taraxaci, commonly known as the common burrweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to brown bracts, which give it a distinctive appearance. Apargia taraxaci is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution across temperate regions.
